content.prompt: In the xy-plane, which of the following is the graph of the implicitly defined function y2=16-x2 ?

choices.label: Both axes range from negative 2 to 2 in increments of 1. The circle is centered at the origin and passes through (negative 2 comma 0), (0 comma 2), (2 comma 0), and (0 comma negative 2).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option A. Refer to its long description

choices.label: Both axes range from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. The circle is centered at the origin and passes through (negative 4 comma 0), (0 comma 4), (4 comma 0), and (0 comma negative 4).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option B. Refer to its long description

choices.label: The x axis ranges from negative 4 to 4 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from 0 to 4 in increments of 1. The semicircle is centered at the origin and passes through (negative 4 comma 0), (0 comma 4), and (4 comma 0).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option C. Refer to its long description

choices.label: Both axes range from negative 16 to 16 in increments of 4. The circle is centered at the origin and passes through (negative 16 comma 0), (0 comma 16), (16 comma 0), and (0 comma negative 16).

assistive_label.label: Figure for Option D. Refer to its long description

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Construct equivalent graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations of functions that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context, with and without technology.
